intro: Rhynchocarpa etbaica, commonly known as the Ethiopian starfruit, is a small shrub native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, star-shaped fruits. The plant produces yellow-orange fruits that are edible and have a tangy, acidic flavor. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a temperate climate with adequate sunlight. Due to its unique appearance and flavor, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
